meanings.definition: A shot that goes out of bounds in a game.
meanings.sent1: During the soccer match, his powerful outshot went over the goal and out of bounds.
meanings.sent2: The basketball player's outshot missed the hoop and landed outside the court.
meanings.sent3: The outshot by the golfer was so strong that it ended up in the neighboring field!
meanings.sent4: Her outshot in archery was like a wild arrow that escaped the target completely.
meanings.sent5: The tennis player's outshot sailed past the line, causing a point for the opponent.

meanings.sent1: She outshot all her competitors in the shooting competition with incredible accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The skilled marksman easily outshot his previous record during practice.
meanings.sent3: He outshot his own expectations by hitting the bullseye every single time.
meanings.sent4: The young archer outshot the experienced hunters with her precise aim.
meanings.sent5: The sniper outshot the enemy soldiers from a distance with unmatched skill.

meanings.definition: A projecting part of a building.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful bay window was the standout feature of the house's outshot.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the building with an elegant outshot that added charm to the structure.
meanings.sent3: The outshot of the house provided a cozy nook for reading and enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The outshot of the mansion resembled a graceful extension reaching towards the garden.
meanings.sent5: The outshot of the cottage created a sunny alcove perfect for growing plants.
